intro: Rumohra hasseltii, commonly known as the giant horsetail, is a perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Equisetaceae and is characterized by its tall, jointed stems and whorled leaves. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments, often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its reproductive structures include strobila, which are cone-like formations that produce spores. Rumohra hasseltii is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural fibers.
